intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium nigrescens subsp. finmarkioides, commonly known as the Finnmark's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern regions of Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of spiny, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
